subject: Religion & Spirituality
subcategory: Sacred Texts That Shaped the World
title: The Epic of Gilgamesh: The First Great Story
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Epic of Gilgamesh: The First Great Story.

hook.text: A king seeks immortality and fails. Written 4,000 years ago, Gilgamesh is humanity's oldest story. It still resonates.

buildup.text: The Sumerian epic tells of King Gilgamesh, who loses his friend Enkidu and goes on a quest to defeat death.

discovery.text: Gilgamesh includes a flood story older than Noah's. A man builds a boat, saves animals, and survives divine wrath.

twist.text: Gilgamesh fails to find eternal life. The message: mortality gives life meaning. Accept death, and truly live.

climax.text: The oldest story in the world says the same thing as the newest: you can't escape death, but you can live fully.

punchline.text: The oldest story says: accept death and live. 4,000 years. Same lesson.

quiz.question: What is the main message of the Epic of Gilgamesh?
options: Accepting mortality gives life its meaning
